name: Venkatesan Guruswami
content: Home Page of Venkatesan Guruswami Venkatesan Guruswami Chancellor's Professor, Department of EECS Director, Simons Institute for the Theory of Computing Professor, Department of Mathematics University of California, Berkeley B.Tech, IIT Madras (1997); Ph.D., MIT (2001); Miller Research Fellow, UC Berkeley (2001-02). Before joining UC Berkeley in Jan 2022, I spent 13+ enjoyable years as a faculty member in the Computer Science Dept at Carnegie Mellon University. Q&A when I joined the Simons Institute "Theory at the Institute and Beyond" columns: July 2023; Feb 2023; Oct 2022 A special picture Teaching in Spring 2026: Proving TCS and Math Theorems using Lean. I am serving as the Editor-in-Chief of Journal of the ACM; please consider submitting your top papers to JACM. Contact Research Advising Teaching Brief bio CV Committees Research Research Publications Interests: Several topics in Theoretical Computer Science, including the theory of error-correcting codes, approximation algorithms & non-approximability, pseudorandomness, probabilistically checkable proofs, algebraic algorithms. Brief description of my current research interests. Below is some further information about my two main research focuses: Error-correcting codes Survey talk on ``List and local decoding": Slides, Video. Survey talk on recent body of work on optimal rate list decoding by evading subspaces. Video of talk. Video of short talk Non-Malleable Coding. A older survey appearing in CACM Mar'09 (in html format) An NSF highlight on our work on list decoding with optimal redundancy. An NSF news article about our work on list decoding Reed-Solomon codes. Article in Science Magazine on list (and local) decoding. Approximate solutions to NP-hard problems Slides from a tutorial on Approximability of CSPs. Slides from 2011 survey talk "PCPs in the last decade" My research over the years has been generously supported by: National Science Foundation, via grants such as CAREER award, CDI.
